互联网3.0时代，什么才是搭建项目官网的正确姿势？
item.description:
互联网3.0时代，什么才是搭建项目官网的正确姿势？

简介

项目背景

国产的CMS系统已经是古董了，国际的主流CMS意识也并不超前，又难以满足极客对真正效率的追求。

本文，将深度探讨，并尝试一次低耦合的CMS系统建设方案。在每个需求环节，选取最佳的技术实现方案，各模块通过RESTful API进行整合及协同。

示例项目 http://vr.anasit.com

技术总览

  • hugo
  • hugo-themes
    • galactica
    • 演示：http://astritbublaku.com/demos/galactica/
  • markdown
  • yaml
  • RESTful APIs
  • github pages
  • rss
  • google ads

系统架构

静态页面生成模块

  • Themes 主题机制
  • Templates 模板机制
  • Taxonomies 分类机制
  • Contents 内容格式化

信息采集聚合模块 aggregator

  • RSS 采集
  • Twiter 采集

内容筛选解析格式化模块

  • Pocket 筛选解析，先存再读的模式

用户审查发布模块

UGC用户自主写文模块

  • 选择一：支持git的markdown编辑器
  • 选择二：支持api获取文章内容的，在线云笔记

item.title: 适合开发者的第三方RSS采集服务选型
item.description:
简介

项目背景

greader+feedly的重度用户，从2014年使用rss开始，为自己节省了大量的信息获取时间提高了对信息捕捉学习的效率。

作为个人用户，所有碰到的基础需求，都可以满足，未考虑付费服务。

但当要将rss整合进系统，实现更加深度的功能时，feedly是否是最适合的选择。

参考文章

观点：不可替代的 RSS，比 Feedly 更好用的 Inoreader RSS 阅读器 InoReader 的使用体验如何？

如何迁移自己的rss订阅？

  1. 登录feedly，点击用户，选择export OPML文件
  2. 将导出的OPML文件导入你想要使用的rss订阅服务

私有云 RSS 聚合器

  • filipedeschamps/rss-feed-emitter
    • nodejs+es6
    • star 621
  • dai-shi/rss-pipes
    • nodejs
    • star 70
  • freshrss.org
    • php+mysql
    • star 382

freshrss

  • php-pdo
  • xml/curl
  • mysql
  • pelican（静态页面生成部分）

公有云 RSS 订阅服务

  • feedly
  • inoreader
  • feedbin
  • feedwrangler

inoreader

缺点

Inoreader对于RSS源的抓取不如Feedly。

  1. 订阅的科大BBS的RSS源，全部乱码出错，而在Feedly并未出现这种问题。

  2. 总共订阅了166个源，其中有30个提示有问题，而这些在feedly上依然可以正常抓取。

简介

http://www.inoreader.com/

开发者平台 http://www.inoreader.com/developers/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MPuG9dEnl-M&feature=youtu.be

资费参考 http://www.inoreader.com/upgrade/feature/from_preferences

Free套餐： - Number of subscriptions Unlimited - Search in subscriptions - RSS Feeds for favorites, channels, folders and tags

  • HTML Clips for favorites, channels, folders and tags Default
  • Unread counter cap (actual unread articles are not limited) 1000
  • Number of active searches 1
  • Number of rules 1
  • Number of filtered feeds 1
  • Number of Highlighters 5
  • Number of boosted feeds 10
  • Number of Google+ feeds 0
  • Number of Twitter feeds 1
  • Number of Facebook page feeds 1
  • Number of VKontakte feeds 1
  • Audio Player Inline
  • Address book - Gmail integrated Limited to 10 entries

feedly

feedly的免费版用户，是否可使用API来读取数据？可以的，Team套餐中Powerful Api，只是对api增强，普通用户同样可以使用api

开发者平台 http://developer.feedly.com/

资费参考 https://feedly.com/i/pro/showcase.zapier

Free套餐: - Up to 100 sources - Mobile and desktop - Organize source into easy-to-read collections - Share to Twitter, Pinterest and Facebook

Refer to “A list of CMSs built with Laravel”

from: http://maxoffsky.com/code-blog/list-cmss-built-laravel/

Yesterday Ryan Tablada organized a Google Hangout in which Matt Staffer, me (Maks Surguy), Jake Chapman, and Alex Dover were discussing CMSs built with Laravel and the future of such systems.

You can watch our discussion here and also read the conversation on Google+ (link on the bottom of this post):

Before the discussion, I had compiled a list of CMSs that already exist or are being built with Laravel and you can see that list below:

Stable

Laravel Bootstrap https://github.com/davzie/laravel-bootstrap
TypiCMS https://github.com/sdebacker/TypiCMS
Bootstrap starter site https://github.com/andrewelkins/Laravel-4-Bootstrap-Starter-Site
Pongo CMS v1 (uses Laravel 3) http://pongocms.com – do not use as v2 is being developed
Wardrobe CMS (blogging) https://github.com/wardrobecms/wardrobe
CodeSleeve https://github.com/CodeSleeve/platform

In development at the moment

PongoCMS v2 http://pongocms.com
October CMS http://octobercms.com/
Larapress https://github.com/larapress-cms/larapress
Coanda https://github.com/CoandaCMS/coanda-core
PyroCMS v3 https://www.pyrocms.com/
Platform (Release Candidate) https://cartalyst.com/manual/platform

Watch our discussion on video

You can watch the discussion and read the comments here: https://plus.google.com/events/caepul2187kfpr84gkluar2mirc

What do you think about CMSs and particularly about the future of CMS? Let me know in the comments or on Twitter.
